H0.text: Behavioral trait is the example of the webbed feet found in most species of ducks.

H1.text: A learned trait is an example of the webbed feet that most species of ducks possess.

H2.text: An inherited trait is exemplified by the webbed feet of most species of ducks.

H3.text: An instinctive trait is exemplified by the webbed feet of most species of ducks.

A4.text: Heredity, also called inheritance or biological inheritance, is the passing on of traits from parents to their offspring; either through asexual reproduction or sexual reproduction, the offspring cells or organisms acquire the genetic information of their parents.

A5.text: August Weismann cut the tails off many generations of mice and found that their offspring continued to develop tails.
